text:
Will you be supporting more field types to Themes? :slightly_smiling_face: Seems from the docs that Themes are currently limited to Number, Color, Image, Font, Boolean and Choice fields: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/themes-reference#fields-json>

Would love to be able to use the same fields that are available in modules. For example the text field, rich text field, link field and menu field would be incredibly useful.
isnt it possible for you to add it by yourself?
as in number 7 on this page : <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/themes-getting-started>
i  might be wrong though, its pretty new for me as well, haven´t been able to take a look into until today.

Yeah, number 7 explains how to add fields, but it seems from the docs that there aren't many field types supported yet. I changed the wording of my initial message a bit to make it more clear what I meant :slightly_smiling_face:
also, it is fresh out of Beta so that might be the reason..
True, just wondering if they have it on their roadmap to support more field types :smile:
<@U4W2EG8RY> thanks for the feedback - talk to me more about the use case. What do you want these fields to control

Hi <@U6W3H6YN8>! :slightly_smiling_face: So, we use coded templates and include global stuff like header, footer etc. as HTML partials. Some of the use cases I have in mind are:

• Rich text field to be used for text in the site footer. For example, company description, copyright information etc.
• Form field so the marketer can select a form for their newsletter signup in the site footer
• Menu selector so the marketer can choose which menus (from Settings: Website > Navigation) to show in the header/footer
• Text/link fields for buttons/special links in the header/footer where using the standard navigation feature would be clunky
• Text fields to control wording/content on the blog listing pages (since these can't be edited by the marketer outside the template itself). For example, should the button below blog posts say "Read more" or "Read now" or whatever.
• Text fields for global stuff on the blog post template. Like, text, CTA's, forms and whatnot to include in the sidebar
• Text field for a tagline below the logo in the header
...and many more :slightly_smiling_face: I realize we could probably solve some of these things with global modules, but then the marketer has to go into the design manager, find the right module and edit it in there. In my head it would make much more sense if all of these theme-specific options were gathered inside of Themes, so the marketer can control all of that from in there.

Thanks! Have you gotten a chance to check out the brand new global content editor? This actually negates the need for marketers to go into the design manager to edit global content. Rather, than can edit all of the modules/fields in global groups/partials or modules directly from within a friendly editor, just like the content editor. Would love to hear if this experience solve the pain you are describing.
Can't say I have - may have missed that memo :slightly_smiling_face: Do you know where I can find a release note or some documentation on that? <@U6W3H6YN8>
A-ha - that's interesting. Will have to play around with it see and what we can do with it. Thanks <@U6W3H6YN8>! :slightly_smiling_face:

Yeah, <@U4W2EG8RY> let us know what you think of that! We’re thinking a lot right now about the relationship between themes and global content because I think there’s a pretty blurry line between them right now.
